description:
The second season of Mahoutsukai no Yome.

Chise was able to accept Elias and herself, if not necessarily everything about her situation. After Cartaphilus fell back into a slumber that would not last forever, Chise was able to go back to her regular life. Then she receives an invitation from a mutual aid organization for mages called the College. Under the British Library exists a secret society of mages. Encounters and interactions with people are about to open some new doors. This is a story about saving yourself to save another.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: Episode 1 of season two premiered in a preview screening event together with "Fuyu no Okorimono" at Tachikawa Cinema City's Cinema Two in Tokyo on March 11, 2023.
synonyms: เจ้าสาวผมแดงกับจอมเวทอสูร ภาค 2

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: POV
tags.description: Point of View; features scenes shown from the perspective of the series protagonist.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Werewolf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a werewolf.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/toxan_7)

**Kouhei Tokuoka** is a Japanese animator, animation supervisor and animation director.

__Birthplace:__ Kushiro, Hokkaido, Japan

__[Website](http://junichimatsumoto.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/junichimatsumo4) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/junichimatsumotoof/) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/unichiatsumoto/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZunc5j3EHKSbN-TwAjqGg) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9D%BE%E6%9C%AC%E6%B7%B3%E4%B8%80)__

Junichi Matsumoto is a composer, arranger and keyboardist. He graduated from Kunitachi College of Music.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Website](http://junnarockyou.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/junnarockyou/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/junnarockyou/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@junna_rockyou?) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnqOw96NU-jDDcFkEXGmnTg) | [Artist Profile](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A025763.html)

Junna Saka, better known as JUNNA is a Japanese pop singer managed by Cube Inc. and signed to FlyingDog.

JUNNA's hobbies include watching YouTube videos. Her favorite food is (dried foods) snacks.

JUNNA is a member of the real-life idol group, [Walküre](https://anilist.co/staff/226500/Walkre)

__[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/sira10/)__

__Birthplace:__ Toride City, Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan

__Yuusuke Shirato__ is a Japanese arranger, composer, lyricist and musician.

__[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/sira10/)__

__Birthplace:__ Toride City, Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan

__Yuusuke Shirato__ is a Japanese arranger, composer, lyricist and musician.

**Birthplace:** Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture, Japan
**Major:** National History

**[Website](http://www.yuhoiwasato.com/)**

**Iwasato Yuuho** is a Japanese lyricist and essayist (and former singer-songwriter), who is well-known for writing the lyrics to many anime theme songs. She graduated from Chuo University Faculty of Letters, Department of History, majoring in national history.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木史朗_(音楽プロデューサー%29) | [Flying Dog](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/)

The founder of record label [flying DOG](https://anilist.co/studio/464/flying-DOG).
Director/COO at I.G Port Inc. and President and founder of Mag Garden.
